text: The Needlework Guild of America was a women's organization. Its corresponding secretary in 1922 was Miss Rosamond K. Bender, of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. During the Great Depression, Frances Cleveland, past First Lady of the United States, led the Needlework Guild of America in its clothing drive for the poor. ==See also== *Embroiderers' Guild of America ==References== Category:Women's clubs in the United States Category:Embroidery in the United States Category:Textile arts of the United States Category:Textile arts organizations Category:Guilds in the United States
title: Needlework Guild of America
